meanings.definition: Ten times as great or as numerous.
meanings.sent1: The giant's strength was tenfold compared to the tiny ant.
meanings.sent2: The population of the city grew tenfold in just a decade.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curiosity was tenfold when it saw a mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness was tenfold brighter than the stars in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the storm was tenfold, leaving a trail of destruction.

meanings.definition: To increase ten times in size or amount.
meanings.sent1: The baker decided to tenfold the recipe to make more bread.
meanings.sent2: With hard work, his savings tenfolded over the years.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to tenfold in size as he pulled out more rabbits.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to tenfold, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waterfall tenfolded as they approached the cliff.
